title: 1  Systems of Linear Equations
text:
2 Solutions to Linear Equations
For the linear equation: \(3x_1 + 5x_2 = 16\), the solution is that \(x_1\) is 2 and \(x_2\) is 2. This, with substitution, would be written as follows: \((3\times 2) + (5\times 2) = 16\)

title: 1  Systems of Linear Equations
text:
1.1 Linear Equations






Definition A linear equation with the variables \(x_1, ..., x_n\) can be written in the form \[
a_1x_1+a2_x2+...+a_nx_n=b
\]



The components of the linear equation is as so:

Each \(x\) is a variable (usually unknown)
Each \(a\) is a weight to each variable (usually known)
Each \(b\) is the product of every \(a_ix_i\) (usually known)
Each component above must be a constant

The following equations are linear:

\(3x_1 + 5x_2 = 16\)
\(2x_1 + \pi x_2 -x_3 = 2\sqrt{6}\)

The following equations are not linear:

\(x_1x_2 = 20\)
\(2\sqrt{x_1} + x_2 = -6\)
\(x_1^3 = 12\)
